Legacy Document

Inside Macintosh: Networking /
Chapter 6 - AppleTalk Transaction Protocol (ATP)

ATP Reference

This section describes the data structures and routines that are specific to ATP.

  • The "Data Structures" section shows the Pascal data structures for the buffer data structure (BDS) array, the ATP parameter block, and the address block record.
  • The "Routines" section describes the ATP routines for making a transaction request, receiving and responding to a transaction request, canceling a call to an ATP function, and building a buffer data structure to be used to hold response data to be sent
    and received.

Subtopics
Data Structures
Routines
